H1588.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H717.def: = to remove fruits and other products from plants

H4753.def: = the gum of a bush or shrub with thick thorny branches that project and bend at odd angles; its leaves come in sets of three; its fruit is oval like a plum; its wood and bark have a pleasant smell; the gum oozes naturally from the branches; clear or yellowish brown when it comes out, but gets darker as it dries; ◄ Commiphora myrrha, abyssinica, or schimperi; ► an ingredient of anointing oil and perfume; ≈ regarded as precious

H1313.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H1706.def: = sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3463.def: = state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H1849.def: = action by which someone strikes a surface noisily to attract attention

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H7474.def: = female person who has a special and intimate relationship with another person

H3123.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H8535.def: literally: completed; hence: = state in which two objects have been made into one

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H2919.def: = condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life-enhancing; associated with fertility

H6977.def: = long locks of hair; ≈ associated with masculine beauty

H7447.def: = state in which there is moisture in the air, which may condense when in contact with air and cooler land surfaces

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

18.gl: to open the door or gate for (someone)

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3801.def: = an undergarment, ◄ woven of linen, ► and worn by the High Priest and his fellow priests; it was worn over the {L:breeches<SDBH:מִכְנָס>}, but from the waist up it was next to the skin; it was a kind of shirt and probably had long sleeves and reached nearly to the ankles and was held in place by a sash wound around the waist.

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H7364.def: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2936.def: = action by which humans cause something to be in touch with dirt

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2356.def: = empty, open place ◄ in a solid body

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H4753.def: = the gum of a bush or shrub with thick thorny branches that project and bend at odd angles; its leaves come in sets of three; its fruit is oval like a plum; its wood and bark have a pleasant smell; the gum oozes naturally from the branches; clear or yellowish brown when it comes out, but gets darker as it dries; ◄ Commiphora myrrha, abyssinica, or schimperi; ► an ingredient of anointing oil and perfume; ≈ regarded as precious

H676.def: = one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H4514.def: = an iron rod used to lock or bar the gate of a city or building

8.gl: to open the door or gate for (someone)

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H2559.def: = action by which humans turn around to face another direction ► in order to leave

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

2.gl: to open the door or gate for (someone)

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7289.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = piece of cloth, worn by women around their head and shoulders as protection against the cold, and possibly for reasons of modesty as well

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H3303.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H6703.def: = state in which the skin of humans is extremely light in color ► to the extent that it reflects light

H122.def: = state in which an object is red or reddish in color

H1713.def: = action by which a group divides itself into smaller groups, organized with the help of {L:banners<SDBH:דֶּגֶל>}

H7233.def: = state in which a countable entity is ten thousand in number; ≈ associated with excessively high numbers by which the exact number is relatively unimportant

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6337.def: = {L:gold<SDBH:זָהָב>} refined to a high level of purity; ≈ considered rare, beautiful and very valuable

H6977.def: = long locks of hair; ≈ associated with masculine beauty

H6158.def: = a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful

H3123.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7364.def: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4402.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = a piece of metal in which a precious stone or gem is fixed to form a piece of jewellery

H3895.def: = the lower bony structure of the skull of humans and certain animals that forms the framework of the mouth and holds the teeth

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H4840.def: = spices that produce a fragrant smell

H7799.def: = a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone-shaped flowers, usually with 5-6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H4753.def: = the gum of a bush or shrub with thick thorny branches that project and bend at odd angles; its leaves come in sets of three; its fruit is oval like a plum; its wood and bark have a pleasant smell; the gum oozes naturally from the branches; clear or yellowish brown when it comes out, but gets darker as it dries; ◄ Commiphora myrrha, abyssinica, or schimperi; ► an ingredient of anointing oil and perfume; ≈ regarded as precious

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1550.def: meaning unsure, possibly: = a small circular band of precious metal, ► used for hanging curtains

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H8658.def: = (semi-)precious stone, possibly kind of beryl, which is colorless in its pure form

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H6247.def: meaning unsure: = artifact of unknown shape, either flat or massive, ◄  made of ivory; ► associated with (male) beauty

H5601.def: = (semi-)precious stone with a deep blue color, possibly sapphire

H7785.def: = the upper part of the leg of humans and animals

H5982.def: = a tall, vertical structure ◄ made of metal, stone, or wood ► and used as support for a building or for decoration

H8336.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H3245.def: = causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction

H134.def: = heavy object with a flat bottom and, in some cases, a hole in its top; ◄ made of stone or metal; ► used as support for a {L:pillar<SDBH:עַמּוּד>} or a {L:wooden frame<SDBH:קֶרֶשׁ>}, to keep it from falling and/or sinking into the ground

H6337.def: = {L:gold<SDBH:זָהָב>} refined to a high level of purity; ≈ considered rare, beautiful and very valuable

H4758.def: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H730.def: = evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H4477.def: = {L:wine<SDBH:יַיִן>} that has been sweetened by adding {L:honey<SDBH:דְּבַשׁ>}

H4261.def: = inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom
